thread.section_title: Top Stories - TOI CRI - Sports - The Times of India
thread.title: Narwal fireworks propel Delhi
thread.title_full: Narwal fireworks propel Delhi - The Times of India

author: Ashish Sen
title: Narwal fireworks propel Delhi
text:
JAIPUR: Sumit Narwal put Delhi in a commanding position with an unbeaten 106 off 94 balls, setting Team Rajasthan a target of 336 on the penultimate day of their Ranji Trophy encounter here on Saturday.
Despite his heroics, it was debutant speedster Nathu Singh, who hogged much of the attention with his seven-wicket haul. Delhi declared their seconds innings at 437/9. By stumps, the hosts lost their opener Pranay Sharma early. They will resume the final day needing another 316.
Young Nathu used the new ball, taken soon after lunch, well to put Delhi on the back foot. Having dismissed skipper Gautam Gambhir (93) and Pradeep Sangwan in the morning session, Nathu picked up another four wickets to reduce the visitors to 291 for seven. That was when Narwal stepped in and handed the initiative back to Delhi. He struck five sixes and 10 boundaries in his blazing innings.
Ashok Menaria's will have to survive an entire day on a deteriorating wicket. As things stand, the hosts would be happy with a draw, having gained the first innings' lead. Overnight batsman Gambhir could not build on his innings as he struggled to get through the nervous 90s. Nathu pacer did the early-morning damage as he trapped Gambhir in front of the stumps.
Gambhir started the day hammering Aniket Choudhary for back-to-back boundaries. He gave the small crowd something to cheer about with some of his trademark shots. His innings was studded with 11 boundaries.
The skipper lost his overnight partner Sangwan early when he was caught by Ankit Lamba at short-leg off Nathu. Nathu, in fact, claimed the first seven wickets. Despite losing two early wickets, Delhi consolidated. Menaria started ringing in the changes searching for breakthroughs.
Ranji Trophy: Round 1, Day 3
Group A : Karnataka 187 and 3948 decl (R Samarth 131, S Puryastha 3-78). Assam 194 and 301. Vidarbha 467 (Umesh Yadav 128 no). Odisha 274 (G Poddar 148, A Wakhare 4-84) and 150.Haryana 335. Maharashtra 2563 (S Gugale 91, A Hooda 2-50).
Group B : Tamil Nadu 125 and 155.Baroda 159 and 114 (D Hooda 32, Rahil Shah 5-43). TN won by 7 runs. Andhra 244 (R Bhui 103, M Kaif 90, BS Sandhu 5-53). Mumbai 1585 (S Lad 63 no, A Bandaru 2-47). UP 6867 decl (A Shaukat 128, M Saif 198, Sarfaraz Khan 155, I Pandey 3-75). MP 2343 (A Shrivastava 99 no, A Rajpoot 2-43).Punjab 6045 decl (Gurkeerat Mann 201 no). Railways 196 (A Singh 90, Barinder Sarn 6-61) and 1255 (P Awasthi 44, Varun Khanna 5-51).
Group C : Saurashtra 307. Tripura 103 (Ravindra Jadeja 6-27) and 86 (R Jadeja 5-45, D Jadeja 4-12).Saurashtra won by innings and 118 runs.
